definitions.definition: A seat across a boat on which a rower may sit.
definitions.example: The fisherman sat on the aft thwart to row.

definitions.definition: A brace, perpendicular to the keel, that helps maintain the beam of a marine vessel against external water pressure and that may serve to support the rail.
definitions.example: A well-made dugout canoe rarely needs a thwart.

definitions.definition: An act of thwarting; something which thwarts; a hindrance, an obstacle.
To cause to fail; to frustrate, to prevent.
definitions.example: Our plans for a picnic were thwarted by the thunderstorm.

definitions.definition: To place (something) across (another thing); to position crosswise.
To hinder or obstruct by placing (something) in the way of; to block, to impede, to oppose.
To move (something) across or counter to; to cross.
Placed or situated across something else; cross, oblique, transverse.
Of people: having a tendency to oppose; obstinate, perverse, stubborn.
Of situations or things: adverse, unfavourable, unlucky.
Across the direction of travel or length of; athwart, crosswise, obliquely, transversely.
